Eric wrote:
> I encounter situations, particularly ones that have heavy
> algorithmics, where the class only exposes certain methods, 
> but one or more of those methods could benefit from being 
> decomposed for testing purposes.  Usually, there is 
> decomposition of the algorithm in the production class. 
> Sometimes, I simply expose what might be thought of
> as private details. Sometimes, I can think of a better way 
> to structure the problem, and am not worried about exposing
> the internals.  But sometimes, I really don't want to expose
> the internals to other production classes, but still want 
> to be able to get at those points for testing.

Would you not extract that functionality into another class and test it
there?  And pass that (unit tested) code into your primary class?  That way
do you not get the best of both worlds - and also the ability to plug in a
new implementation as/when required?

Jonathan
